ODE XXXI.

The death of Cleopatra put an end to the war between Au- gustus and Antony. This is one of several odes which Horace wrote on that occasion. The character and tragical end of Cleopatra are strikIngly represented. Her passions are in vio- lent motion 3 her ambition is intoxication 3 her love is madnessÍ¾ and her courage is despair.
